intro: Ceratocephalus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a rough texture, while the flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. Ceratocephalus bicolor is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
